Description: Neck and shoulder sherd of Attic black-figured pottery stamnos or probably column-krater; interior: glazed black on neck and lowest part of sherd, reserved between; exterior: glazed black on neck and ridge at junction with shoulder; added white band at junction with shoulder; tongue pattern; below, black-figure decoration consisting of, from left, youth (head and shoulder remaining with added red fillet) to right; back of head and shoulder of second figure to right; part of head with red fillet of third figure to left, with raised hand, and head with red fillet of fourth figure to left.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by Musée du Louvre. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
233 written in pencil on interior; D: 14.00 neck. For the treatment of the inside compare Kyoto University 639.1c.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GA.2085)
